definition: to blow/to play a wind instrument/to blast/to puff/to boast/to brag/to end in failure/to fall through

sentences.english: Net curtains blow slightly in the breeze.
sentences.chinese: 紗網窗簾被微風輕輕吹拂。

sentences.english: A soft breeze gently disturbed the surface of the pool.
sentences.chinese: 一陣微風吹拂了平靜的池塘。

sentences.english: However, a tree on the coast, exposed to a constant wind from the sea, bends away from the blast.
sentences.chinese: 然而，海邊的樹常年受海風吹拂，總朝順風方向彎曲。

sentences.english: Plastic buckets and balls roll around in the breeze.
sentences.chinese: 塑料小桶和沙灘球在海風的吹拂下四處滾動。

sentences.english: Spring sway over leaves, rain Run to open Shan Lihong.
sentences.chinese: 春風吹拂滿枝葉，細雨潤開山裏紅。

sentences.english: My breathing shakes the bluet like a breeze.
sentences.chinese: 我的呼吸像微風一般吹拂藍色的小花。

sentences.english: In my fantasy exists a warm wind.
sentences.chinese: 我彷彿感覺一席暖風吹拂。

sentences.english: Blue birds sing beautifully, and the south wind blows gently.
sentences.chinese: 藍鳥優美地唱歌，南風也輕輕地吹拂。

sentences.english: I want the wind to blow your shade to hug me.
sentences.chinese: 我情不自禁這風要將吹拂你的身影來擁抱著我。

sentences.english: All nature was still, and the soft, mild air fanned her forehead.
sentences.chinese: 萬籟俱寂，柔和的微風吹拂她的前額。

sentences.english: The clouds cleared away, and a fresh breeze sprang up.
sentences.chinese: 烏雲四散，清新的微風吹拂着。

sentences.english: Blue birds sing beautifully when the south wind blows gently.
sentences.chinese: 當南風輕輕地吹拂，藍鳥優美地唱歌。

sentences.english: It bloweth in every direction, as bidden by its Creator.
sentences.chinese: 在其創造者的命令下，它向四面八方吹拂。

sentences.english: Magnolia petals in Feng ER-Wind, they have to fall.
sentences.chinese: 玉蘭的花瓣在風兒的吹拂下，也紛紛地落下。

sentences.english: Windswept dunes and waving grasses border the Atlantic Ocean.
sentences.chinese: 微風吹拂沙丘和揮舞草邊境大西洋。

definition: (of a breeze) to make (hair, leaves, clothing etc) sway gently/to ruffle
to sway gently (as in the wind)/(of a flame) to flicker
to drift/to wave/to float on the waves/to flutter in the wind
sea breeze/sea wind (i.e. from the sea)
to fly up/to dance in the air (of snowflakes, flower petals etc)
